14.content: how does Ms. Fortune's story start
14.title: Ms. Fortune

choices: Ms, fortune gets where Minette is coming from and agrees.

141.content:
Ms. Fortune walked into Yu-Wan's Restaurant feeling downcast.

"what's wrong Nadia?" Minette asked as Ms. fortune sat down.

"My latest theft wound up being a sting I got away but without the Ruby. while you're here could you get me-" Ms. fortune was cut off by the sound of a plate clinking down in front of her.

"Tuna on Rye. A healthy meal for a despondent feline, on the house."

"Thanks Minette but I'm going to need more than your charity to make it through the week. That Ruby was supposed to pay my rent. I need to come up with something fast or I'm going to wind up an alley cat."

"Actually my charity might sustain you yet" Minette replied. "I've been looking for a roommate recently and since were already friends it might be a good idea."

"Weren't you listening this pussy's penniless no matter how finely you divide the rent money I'm still stuck in the same problem I am right now. and before you make the offer I'm not going to let you pay my way without giving something back"

"Maybe, maybe not there's a lot of ways for a pussy like you to to make up for the expenses." Minette said was a wink.

142.content:
Ms. Fortune sat chained to a wall heavy braces and chains constricted her as much as possible and without the leverage necessary to separate her body she was completely trapped. Nadia stared out across the cellar that she was imprisoned in feeling her hopes sink with every passing second, on the edge of her hearing she could tell members of the Medici Mafia were discussing how to best 'recover' the life gem. to her surprise a figure approached out of the gloom it was Cerebella famous Acrobat and Mafia leg breaker. Nadia was about to say something when Cerebella put a finger to her lips to silence her. Vice-Versa's strong arms tore away Ms. Fortune's bonds like they were made of tissue paper. Cerebella helped her up and led her by the arm to a window leading out into the moonless night.
"why are you doing this?" Ms. Fortune asked but Cerebella said nothing and instead slipped a folded piece of paper into Nadia's hand. although it might have been a trick of the poor lighting but Ms. Fortune could have sworn that the green haired Acrobat was blushing.

Ms. Fortune climbed out the window and ran. only when she was far away back in the relative safety of Little Innsmouth did she unfold the paper and read it.

'Nadia as strange as it must be to hear this from me of all people I think you're the most beautiful woman I've ever met please meet me at the Shadowjack Café at noon tomorrow

Nadia jaw dropped She was being asked out on a date by a woman who might have well been the Medici Mafia's mascot. On one hand the whole idea was ludicrous not to mention dangerous she remembered how Romeo and Juliet ended. On the other hand playing to this girls affections could give her an opportunity to get at Vitale Medici. after some deliberation she came to a decision
142.title: she's captured by the Medici Mafia and save...

choices: Parasoul had entered the cafe with a few Egrets for lunch
An unknown mobster walks in for lunch.
1421.content:
The feline thief pondered this for a second. One one hand, she was a mobster with a hat that could pound her into oblivion. Not to mention ties with the Medici Mafia who would no doubt like to catch an escaped prisoner, the last member of the Fishbone Gang, and more importantly, the holder of the Life Gem. Any self respecting thief or any breaker of the law would see this as an unneeded risk and leave it.

But on the other hand, she was just saved by that mobster who could have all the reasons in the world for killing her. And she guess she owed her something even if it was something as little a date. Either way, that acrobat was pretty cute...

Miss Fortune sighed to herself. I owe her this. She saved my life after all... her stomach interrupted her train of thought. And a free lunch isn't too bad either!

_______________________________


Carefully peeking out from behind an alley, Nadia Fortune scanned the cafe up and down for any sign of mobsters that might be wait for her. It was natural for her because she was an expert thief that didn't want to run into trouble, and she didn't quite trust Cerebella.

When she decided the coast was clear, she walked casually into the Shadowjack Cafe. She spotted Cerebella, chin in one hand staring, eyelids drooped, out the window (apparently not noticing Nadia) behind a mug of steaming coffee. Nadia was relieved when she saw no sign of that diamond-backed hat of hers or any mafia members. Maybe she could trust her...

Nadia tip-toed over (force of habit for a theif of her caliber) to Cerebella's table and sat in the booth across from her. Cerebella ceased looking out the window then to her coffee, and caught a glance of the cat-woman that had appeared in the seat across from her - causing her to jump and nearly spill her coffee.

"Good lord, how long have you been sitting there?" asked the circus performer still trying to catch her breath.

"Just got here," Nadia shrugged "And it seems you invited quite the kitty given your purr-fession"

Cerebella giggled at the use of cat lingo, "Well I thought I might give the privilege to the stray I saved to meet their savior in person."

Egotistical. Expected for a mobster/celebrity of her stature, but cute nonetheless. Miss Fortune opened her mouth to reply but Cerebella's eyes shot towards the person who had just walked into the cafe, and her expression wasn't too reassuring.
1421.title: Meeting a Mobster
